Description: Bust of Mark Antony facing right. (obverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Republic Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Republic
Curator's comments: The mint of Antioch produced a drachm coinage in its own name, but with a portrait of Antony on the obverse. On the reverse appeared the head of Tyche with the legend 'of the metropolis of the people of Antioch'. The date of the issue cannot be determined with precision. In concept, this coinage is analogous to, though of higher value than, the city bronze coinages with Antony and Cleopatra's portraits.
Bibliographic references: RPC1 / Roman provincial coinage. Vol.1, From the death of Caesar to the death of Vitellius (44 BC-AD 69) (4135)
BMC Greek (Galatia) / Catalogue of the Greek coins of Galatia, Cappadocia and Syria (52, p.157)
Walker & Higgs 2001 / Cleopatra of Egypt: from History to Myth (218)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Antiochia ad Orontem (Antioch)
